gololang.ir

Class GoloElement<T extends GoloElement<T>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • gololang.ir.GoloElement<T>
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Augmentation, Decorator, GoloModule, GoloStatement, GoloType, LocalReference, Member, ModuleImport, NamedAugmentation, ToplevelElements, WhenClause

    public abstract class GoloElement<T extends GoloElement<T>>
extends java.lang.Object
    Generic IR tree Element.

    The IR tree represents a more abstract representation of the Golo code.

      • metadata

        public final T metadata(java.lang.String name,
                        java.lang.Object value)
        Stores a meta-data in this element.

        A meta-data can be any object. The main purpose is to allow visitors or macros to store some generic informations in the IR that can be used later by other macros or compilation steps (for instance add some Java annotations to the generated methods).

      • cantReplace

      • replaceInParentBy

        public final void replaceInParentBy(GoloElement<?> newElement)
        Replaces this element by the given one in its parent node.

        This method is typically used during the sugar and macros expansion stages to replace the element by a desugarized version, or the macro call by its result.

        Parameters:
        newElement - the element to replace this one with.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this element has no parent.

      • accept

        public abstract void accept(GoloIrVisitor visitor)
        Accept the visitor.

        This method should only call the visitor visitXXXX method. The children of this node will be visited by the walk(GoloIrVisitor) method.

      • walk

        public void walk(GoloIrVisitor visitor)
        Walk the visitor through this node children.

      • replaceElement

        protected abstract void replaceElement(GoloElement<?> original,
                                       GoloElement<?> newElement)
        Replace a child.

        Replace original with newElement if original is a child of this node and type matches.

        Parameters:
        original - the original value to replace. Must be a child of this node
        newElement - the element to replace with. Type must match.
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if this node does not support replacement
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - if original is not a child of this node
        java.lang.ClassCastException - if the type of newElement does not match
        See Also:
        cantReplace(), cantReplace(GoloElement, GoloElement), doesNotContain(GoloElement), cantConvert(String, Object)
